note.p: Birth: Ealing, Middlesex, England (04 May 1825)
Death: Eastbourne, Sussex (29 June 1895)
Burial: Finchley, Middlesex
Profession: Surgeon
Research Field: Zoology, evolution, palaeontology, ethnology
Career: Assistant Surgeon, Royal Navy; served aboard HMS Rattlesnake on surveying voyage to Australia and the Great Barrier Reef
Relocation of Imperial College where he worked for 40 years to South Kensington
Membership: Fellow
Election Date: 5/06/1851
Medals/Prizes: Royal Medal 1852; Copley Medal 1888; Darwin Medal 1894
Lectures: Croonian 1858
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB
